Articles.Content:
(BTW, the reason I'm so polite in this letter is because I'm talking to a person who is 16 years older than me.)

Dear Mr. Moach,

Are you Mr. HarvesteR's brother? I downloaded the SDK and saw in the read me 'Moach' and the same last name as Mr. HarvesteR twice. I knew that one of them was Mr. HarvesteR's last name.

Regards,

chrislo27 (username, not Cave Johnson)

He is actually. I mentioned him on the credits for the vector tool, because it started out as something he made for his Orbiter addons. He gave me permission to modify it for KSP, so I added the KSP syntax format for it.

But he's not directly related to KSP development. We actually live in different countries

Cheers

Thank you.

And why are you both 26?

Twins?

(Now that I think about it, it can't be. But I don't regret saying that.)

yes, twins : - it happens sometimes

he's got more hair, so it's easy to tell us both apart, tho :cheers:

Thanks!

So I've learned a couple of things.

1) HarvesteR has more hair than his brother

2) You two live in two different countries (which are anonymous, hint hint)

3) Twins

4)And I shouldn't be so so polite when talking to devs.

This thread made me laugh from ear to ear.

Who was first btw?

5) I can be a comedian at unexpected times.

And who was first?

countries are Mexico (Harvester) and Brazil (me) :

he was first... by five minutes or so i'm told :cheers:

Yea... The names seemed so Souh Ameriain

Some of my keys are broke. Ta's for e errors.

abdefgijklmnopqrsuwxyz

So your last names are malay, according to translate.

Felipe is spanish.

Guilherme is portuguese.

And my keys have started to work again!

EDIT

Guilherme means William in portuguese.

So your last names are malay, according to translate.

That's new to me.

Actually it's supposed to be italian, but there have been a few errors in translation along the way

Cheers

Ah. I think we can stop now.

Or not.

(BTW, HarverstR, what is KSP programmed in?)

Ah. I think we can stop now.

Or not.

(BTW, HarverstR, what is KSP programmed in?)

I believe he stated in another thread they are using C#.

Arrr!

Capt'n Skunky

I learnt Lua (and true Lua, with all the metafunctions) by Roblox. I learnt Java from a good friend of mine.

I should learn C, then C#, like my dad said.

EDIT:

So the game is in C# and they may use Lua in the future.

I wanna be a dev.

But my Lua skills probably aren't good enough.

I should learn C, then C#, like my dad said.

your dad said? - you mean like this? http://www.youtube.com/embed/d9JIiCkDyMQ?rel=0

if you know Java, then C# should be a no-brainer... since features aside, the two are almost identical :

neither is as awesome as C++ tho... :cheers:

No.

And it was

Lua

Java

C

C++

C#

and whatever I want

Still on java and it's been 2 years of the project.
